line_2: That binds the soul of Harmony!

line_1: With me the bands of sleep untie,
line_2: Nor damask cheek, nor spaikling eye,

line_1: My oxen from their yoke I must untye,
line_2: Who labours much the sweets of rest should try.

line_1: My oxen from their yoke I must untye,
line_2: To their warm nests the daws and ravens fly

line_1: My oxen from their yoke I must untye,
line_2: And beasts and birds fast lock'd in slumber lye,

line_1: The fatal shears the fragile threads untie,
line_2: And the cropt rose gives up her crimson dye;

line_1: The Chain I'll in Return unty;
line_2: And freely Thou again shalt fly.
